author: keith
msg: The statusHandler is returning a body for 304 responses,
which is forbidden by both HTTP/1.1 and HTTP/1.0.
IE is forgiving, but Netscape Navs < 6.x assume that a
body is not there, even if the content-length is set
(it is).  So, the 304 response body gets munged with the
next response body.  Of course, this does not happen
standalone because the bug requires connections to be

author: billbarker
msg: Document fix for 304 response on included pages.

author: billbarker
msg: Don't check dates if the static page is part of a jsp:include

This was reported as Bug 5497 against 4.x.  In the report, it only happened because of a buggy browser, but there are still possible (if rare) for a servlet to set the Last-Modified header.  In any case, we can't send a 304 response even if we wanted to for an included page.
